action.action-desc: Mr. O'Halleran introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Watershed Protection and Flood Prevention Act to allow additional flood prevention measures on certain lands, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fire Recovery Improvement Act.
The Watershed Protection and Flood Prevention Act (16 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In carrying out this Act, the Secretary, acting through the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service, may—

paragraph.text: carry out activities on eligible lands to address the effects of flooding in downstream communities; and

carry out activities to mitigate potential effects of flooding in downstream communities upon the receipt of an independent hydraulic study that shows that severe and repetitive flooding is likely in such communities.
The term downstream community means a community that—

subparagraph.text: is located on land not under the jurisdiction of the Forest Service; and
is threatened by post-wildfire flooding in such community due to a post-wildfire burn scar on adjacent or upstream Forest Service lands.

paragraph.text: The term eligible land means land that is—

subparagraph.text: located in a county in which less than 50 percent of the land is privately owned; and
under the jurisdiction of the Forest Service.
